title: Echoes of Yesteryear
setting_narration: The wind whispers through the plains of Windwail, carrying the scent of Cecilia flowers as the last rays of sun kiss the colossal Statue of the Seven. A profound quiet descends upon the land, broken only by the rustling leaves.

segments.text: Diluc stands before the Anemo Archon's statue, his silhouette sharp against the fading light. His gaze is distant, lost in thought as the world around him slowly drifts into twilight.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Even in silence, some burdens weigh heavy.

segments.text: A familiar, almost too casual voice breaks the quiet serenity, accompanied by the light crunch of footsteps on the path.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Fancy meeting you here, Master Diluc. Seeking solace from the Archon, perhaps? Or merely enjoying the melancholic view?

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: My reasons are my own, Captain Kaeya. And yours, I presume, are equally veiled in performative nonchalance?

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: Just a stroll, my dear brother. Though, a place like this does make one ponder... past connections. Lost affections, perhaps?

segments.text: Diluc's posture stiffens almost imperceptibly, a flicker of something unreadable in his eyes as he finally turns to face Kaeya.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: Unnecessary sentimentality. The past is precisely that â€” past. There is no merit in dwelling on what is gone.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.expression_action: (a hint of genuine sadness in his voice)
segments.line: Is it ever truly? Some memories linger longer than others. Especially those tied to a certain... warmth. Or a cold hand in yours, if one is prone to such imagery.

segments.text: A heavy silence descends, thick with unspoken history and shared, complicated pain. The wind picks up, rustling through the nearby trees as the last vestiges of daylight fade.

segments.speaker: Diluc
segments.line: We have different ways of remembering, Kaeya. Mine involves moving forward.

segments.speaker: Kaeya
segments.line: And mine, perhaps, involves acknowledging that some parts of us are forever shaped by those we once held dear. Even if only in memory. Good evening, Master Diluc.
